description.plain:
“Figure It Out” came out on April 17, 2020, and was the fourth single release from NYC-based artist Blu DeTiger. Released this during the coronavirus pandemic, it immediately blew up on TikTok, along with videos of her playlist bass. Blu actually wrote the track back in April of 2019, but decided to release it a year later once it was finished, seeing as it matched the times so well. In an interview with Invertebrate, Blu says:

I was also a little bit scared to put out stuff because it was such a weird time, too. I feel like a lot of people were listening to older music for comfort and familiarity, and I was too. I wasn’t really checking out anything new, but then I think it came to the point where people were craving new stuff and they wanted new entertainment. So yeah, it’s just funny because I wrote it so long ago, but it was so meant to be— the time it came out. If it came out any earlier, it wouldn’t have made the same impact, you know?

annotatable.title: Figure It Out

body.plain:
“Figure It Out” came out on April 17, 2020, and was the fourth single release from NYC-based artist Blu DeTiger. Released this during the coronavirus pandemic, it immediately blew up on TikTok, along with videos of her playlist bass. Blu actually wrote the track back in April of 2019, but decided to release it a year later once it was finished, seeing as it matched the times so well. In an interview with Invertebrate, Blu says:

I was also a little bit scared to put out stuff because it was such a weird time, too. I feel like a lot of people were listening to older music for comfort and familiarity, and I was too. I wasn’t really checking out anything new, but then I think it came to the point where people were craving new stuff and they wanted new entertainment. So yeah, it’s just funny because I wrote it so long ago, but it was so meant to be— the time it came out. If it came out any earlier, it wouldn’t have made the same impact, you know?

annotations: While I’m switchin’ lanes the Danica way

“The Danica way” is referring to professional race car driver Danica Patrick. She is widely referred to as the most successful woman in the history of American open-wheel racing; she is the only woman ever to win an IndyCar Series race, winning the 2008 Indy Japan 300.

Don’t know what you’re sayin’
 You’re flyin’ higher than a plane
 And I’m not complainin’
 It’s gettin’ too loud, we’ll figure it out

In early July 2020, the opening to the verses of “Figure It Out” made waves on TikTok, having racked up a little over 400,000 uses as of March 2021. Following the song’s peak on TikTok, DeTiger sat down with Invertebrate Music and discussed what the song going viral meant to her:

It’s insane! I think the coolest part, too, is all these young kids reaching out to me about them learning how to play bass and it’s so cute! They’ll learn the bassline for “Figure It Out” and post it and tag me in it. It’s so cute and I’ve never had that! I’ve always wanted that— inspiring and empowering people to play an instrument. I’ve just always wanted that; when I was growing up I never saw a girl like me in that main pop sphere doing that, so I think that’s the most exciting part about all of it, is seeing these kids learn bass. It’s so cool!

Figure it out, just figure it out
 You’ll figure it out, just figure it out, just figure it out

Even though she wrote this song in April 2019, the song came out in April 2020, in the midst of Coronavirus quarantining. She said to Invertebrate:

I just had a gut feeling that I wanted to put this song out, and it kind of made sense with the whole Corona stuff that was happening. It’s like, we’ll “figure it out;” it felt more uplifting. So I felt the content of the song would fit well with the time, so I’m glad it came out when it did!

As a bass player, Blu often starts with the drum and bass groove when writing a song. She mentioned in an interview with Invertebrate:

This song started with that groove, and I was in a session with my friend and the words just kind of came out. It’s funny because my other songs start with a concept usually or something I’ve been thinking about, but this song just flowed out. I think it was subconsciously about something I must have been thinking about in those days but I couldn’t pinpoint it. So that song just kind of came out and it was written in like 20 minutes— the lyrics and the melody.

description.plain: Released in January 2021, Vintage combines ‘80s synth influences with modern pop vibes and backs it up with a strong bass. The track achieved some prominence after being featured on alternative radio stations and a Spotify ad.

annotations: Always holds the door but I found him in a mosh pit

Blu explains how this guy she found is very kind and “well-mannered” by holding the door for her, yet right after contrasts that behavior by saying she found him in a place where she wouldn’t expect him to be in
